metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13142 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In ImageMagick before 6.9.9-0 and 7.x before 7.0.6-1, a crafted PNG file could trigger a crash because there was an insufficient check for short files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 0114-Validate-png-file.patch in unstable 0091-Validate-png-file.patch in stretch 0294-CVE-2017-13142-Fix-short-file-check-in-png.c-1-2.patch and 0295-CVE-2017-13142-Fix-short-file-check-in-png.c-2-2.patch in wheezy

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11').
